deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2090-05-14
Patient Name: DALEY,WADE [ MRN: 5694653MEDIQUIK ]
Date of Visit: 05/14/2090
Personal Data and Overall Health
PCP: Dr Xavier
Onc: Dr Paz
ID: 54 M
Chief Complaint
Fever
History of Present Illness
Pt diagnosed with APML 11/89, undergoing successful induction and consolidation therapy, completeing last cycle yesterday 5/13, taken over past week. He was in his USOH until over the past week he has had low grade fever in 99s. He normally runs 97s. There were no other related infectious sx: no cough/V/D/CP/AP. He did note HA. On the day PTA he had diarrhea x1, nonbloddy/watery. he also experienced flu-lke aches in joints, esp knees and shoulders. He has a Hickman line (8 months), with mild discomfort but no erythema. No neurologic symptoms or back pain. He notes decreased PO past week.
Past Medical History
(1) APML: Originally presented 11/89 with 2 weeks of cough, fatigue, and bruising. Workup revealed low CBC and BMBx confirmed APML. he was induced with ATRA and idarubicin, acheiving complete remission. He was recently consolidated with idarubicin and ATRA, last given 5/7/90.
(2) HTN: on meds past 3 years
(3) DM: mild, on PO meds past 4 years.
(4) Carpal tunnel syndrome
(5) Spondylosis
Past Surgical History
(1) Subtotal thyroidectomy for adenoma
Medications
Synthroid 125 QD
Zestril 40 QD
Lopressor 100 TID
Glucophage 850 QID
Allergies
NKDA. Allergic to onions
Family History
N/C
Social History
Born and raised NYC area. Lives at home with wife and 3 kids, one is newborn 6 weeks old! Works as manager for Antec.
Habits
Quit smoking 10 years ago, 1 ppd. occassional alcohol.

102.1 80 110/74 20

Impression
54 M w 6 month h/o APML, s/p induction and consolidation chemotherapy, p/w 1 week low grade fever, now 102, and cytopenia.
Problems
(1) ID: no known source. No respiratory or urinary sx. possible culprit is Hickam line. Joint aches sound viral. He has 3 small children at home.
-pan cx
-CXR
-Cefepime and Vanco
-C Diff
(2) Pancytopenia: WBC 1.9, Hct 34, Plts 129.
-no need for transfusions at this point.
(3) DM: Good control with oral hypoglycemics
-cont glucophage
(4) HTN: good control with BB and ACE
-cont lopressor and zestril
(5) Endo: hypothyroid from thyroidectomy. TFTs checked q3M
-cont synthroid
